definition: finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
to take/to borrow/to pick (flowers, fruit etc)/to pluck/to select/to remove/to take off (glasses, hat etc)

sentences.chinese: 我決不再是無可指摘的了。

sentences.english: And have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather reprove them.
sentences.chinese: 不要參與黑暗無益的作爲，反要加以指摘。

sentences.english: The judge exceeded his powers in criticizing the court ofappeal.
sentences.chinese: 法官越權對上訴法院進行指摘抉剔。

sentences.english: His grandfather is always carping  about the young.
sentences.chinese: 他的祖父總是指摘青年人不懂事。

sentences.english: The author believed that these criticize speciously, with historical actually not symbol.
sentences.chinese: 筆者認爲，這些指摘都似是而非，與歷史實際不符。

sentences.english: He usually spoke dispraisingly to the student who failed in the examination.
sentences.chinese: 封考試不及格的學生，他常加以指摘。

sentences.english: My own views, admittedly somewhat speculative, are that they probably do not consider their actions as reprehensible .
sentences.chinese: 以筆者揣想，他們大概是認爲此等行爲無可指摘。

sentences.english: My behaviour as an international civil servant must be beyond reproach.
sentences.chinese: 我作爲一名國際公務員的行爲必須無可指摘。

definition: to attack sb by exposing faults/to denounce
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
to speak sarcastically/to make cutting remarks
